pages.text: In order to Inject, first you must obtain a drill, a power crystal and an injector tank. A mica and a pebble may be useful to you.

pages.name: Injector Multiblock
pages.text: A basic setup for gem injection requires Chroma and gem essences.

After opening the GUI, place the Chroma you'd like to use in the first slot to the right of the essence bars.$(br2)The Chroma determines the gem's color if it has multiple variants. Prismatic Chroma gives a random color or an exclusive color variant.
The following slot next to the Chroma slot is used for primer items. These items help influence a gem type to pop out from the ground.$(br2)Gem pages list their favored primer item for injection.

pages.title: Gem Essence
pages.text: Don't forget to fill your bars! There's a slot at the top of the bars for gem essence bottles and congealed gem essences.$(br2)Each gem requires a specific color combination, but using all four essences will give any gem with the risk of lower quality gems.$(br2)Click the bars to select the color you want to use.
Something to note is that tier two injectors have more slots available. These are used for prime boost items and speed boost items, influencing quality and emergence time.

pages.title: Injecting
pages.text: Last but not least: in order to inject you can place a button, hand pedestal or some form of a redstone contraption leading to the back of the injector tank block.$(br2)After triggering it this will make the injector place a gem seed into the earth, which slowly drains nearby blocks to form a gem.
